version.description:
Unicode 1.1 were pre-dated emoji inclusion in Unicode by 17 years, and included many characters primarily sourced from the Zapf Dingbats font.

The following characters were added to Unicode in 1993 and many were given emoji presentation status in the years 2010-2015.

emoji_net_data.name: reverse button

bn:13642121v: To wind (a tape, cassette, or film, etc) towards the beginning; to rewind.
To wind a magnetic tape spool or cassette to its beginning.

bn:00005896n: A mark to indicate a direction or relation
A mark to indicate a direction or relation.
A sign or symbol used to indicate a direction (e.g. \to).

bn:00050521n: The most common relative directions are left, right, forward, backward, up, and down.
One direction or side, as opposed to right. The west side of the body when one is facing north.
Location near or direction toward the left side; i.e. the side to the north when a person or object faces east
Up, down, left, right, forwards, backwards
